commands.name: _completion
commands.description: BASH completion hook.
commands.help:
To enable BASH completion, run:

    <comment>eval `[program] _completion -g`</comment>.

Or for an alias:

    <comment>eval `[program] _completion -g -p [alias]`</comment>.

commands.name: help
commands.description: Displays help for a command
commands.help:
The <info>help</info> command displays help for a given command:

  <info>magento-cloud help list</info>

You can also output the help in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>magento-cloud help --format=xml list</info>

To display the list of available commands, please use the <info>list</info> command.

commands.name: legacy-migrate
commands.description: Migrate from the legacy file structure
commands.help:
Before version 3.x, the Magento Cloud CLI required a project to have a "repository"
directory containing the Git repository, "builds", "shared" and others. From
version 3, the Git repository itself is treated as the project. Metadata is
stored inside the repository (in .magento/local) and ignored by Git.

This command will migrate from the old file structure to the new one.

no-backup.description: Do not create a backup of the project.

commands.name: list
commands.description: Lists commands
commands.help:
The <info>list</info> command lists all commands:

  <info>magento-cloud list</info>

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

  <info>magento-cloud list project</info>

You can also output the information in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>magento-cloud list --format=xml</info>

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

  <info>magento-cloud list --raw</info>

commands.name: auth:api-token-login
commands.description: Log in to Magento Cloud using an API token
commands.help:
Use this command to log in to your Magento Cloud account using an API token.

You can create an account at:
    <info>https://accounts.magento.cloud</info>

If you have an account, but you do not already have an API token, you can create one here:
    <info>https://accounts.magento.cloud/user/api-tokens</info>

Alternatively, to log in to the CLI with a browser, run:
    <info>magento-cloud auth:browser-login</info>

commands.name: auth:browser-login
commands.description: Log in to Magento Cloud via a browser
commands.help:
Use this command to log in to the Magento Cloud CLI using a web browser.

It launches a temporary local website which redirects you to log in if
necessary, and then captures the resulting authorization code.

Your system's default browser will be used. You can override this using the
<info>--browser</info> option.

Alternatively, to log in using an API token (without a browser), run:
<info>magento-cloud auth:api-token-login</info>

To authenticate non-interactively, configure an API token using the
<info>MAGENTO_CLOUD_CLI_TOKEN</info> environment variable.

commands.name: auth:token
commands.description: Obtain an OAuth 2 access token for requests to Magento Cloud APIs
commands.help:
This command prints a valid OAuth 2 access token to stdout. It can be used
to make API requests via standard Bearer authentication (RFC 6750).

<comment>Warning: access tokens must be kept secret.</comment>

Using this command is not generally recommended, as it increases the chance
of the token being leaked. Take care not to expose the token in a shared
program or system, or to send the token to the wrong API domain.

<comment>Examples:</comment>

Print the payload for JWT-formatted tokens:
  <info>magento-cloud auth:token -W | cut -d. -f2 | base64 -d</info>

Use the token in a curl command:
  <info>curl -H"$(magento-cloud auth:token -HW)" https://api.magento.cloud/users/me</info>

header.name: --header
header.description: Prefix the token with "Authorization: Bearer " to make an RFC 6750 header

no-warn.name: --no-warn
no-warn.description: Suppress the warning that is printed by default to stderr. This option is preferred over redirecting stderr, as that would hide other potentially useful messages.

commands.name: blue-green:enable
commands.description: <fg=white;bg=red>[ ALPHA ]</> Enable blue/green deployments
commands.help:
Use this command to enable blue/green deployments on an environment.

If multiple environment versions do not already exist, this creates a new version as a copy of the current one.

100% of traffic is routed to the current version, and 0% to the new version. This can be flipped or changed with the blue-green:deploy command.

While blue/green deployments are "enabled" (while multiple versions exist), the current version is "locked", and deployments (e.g. from Git pushes) affect the new version.

routing-percentage.name: --routing-percentage
routing-percentage.description: Set the latest version's routing percentage

commands.description: Delete one or more environments
commands.help:
When a Magento Cloud environment is deleted, it will become "inactive": it will
exist only as a Git branch, containing code but no services, databases nor
files.

This command allows you to delete environment(s) as well as their Git branches.

environment.name: environment
environment.description: The environment(s) to delete. The % character may be used as a wildcard. If a list is given as a single value (e.g. "a,b,c") it will be split by commas and/or whitespace.

no-delete-branch.name: --no-delete-branch
no-delete-branch.description: Do not delete Git branch(es) (inactive environments)

type.name: --type
type.description: Delete all environments of a type (adding to any others selected) If a list is given as a single value (e.g. "a,b,c") it will be split by commas and/or whitespace.

only-type.name: --only-type
only-type.description: Only delete environment(s) of a specific type If a list is given as a single value (e.g. "a,b,c") it will be split by commas and/or whitespace.

exclude.name: --exclude
exclude.description: Environment(s) not to delete. The % character may be used as a wildcard. If a list is given as a single value (e.g. "a,b,c") it will be split by commas and/or whitespace.

exclude-type.name: --exclude-type
exclude-type.description: Environment type(s) of which not to delete If a list is given as a single value (e.g. "a,b,c") it will be split by commas and/or whitespace.

inactive.name: --inactive
inactive.description: Delete all inactive environments (adding to any others selected

commands.name: environment:synchronize
commands.description: Synchronize an environment's code and/or data from its parent
commands.help:
This command synchronizes to a child environment from its parent environment.

Synchronizing "code" means there will be a Git merge from the parent to the
child. Synchronizing "data" means that all files in all services (including
static files, databases, logs, search indices, etc.) will be copied from the
parent to the child.

commands.name: integration:validate
commands.description: Validate an existing integration
commands.help:
This command allows you to check whether an integration is valid.

An exit code of 0 means the integration is valid, while 4 means it is invalid.
Any other exit code indicates an unexpected error.

Integrations are validated automatically on creation and on update. However,
because they involve external resources, it is possible for a valid integration
to become invalid. For example, an access token may be revoked, or an external
repository may be deleted.

id.description: An integration ID. Leave blank to choose from a list.

commands.description: Check the disk usage of mounts
commands.help:
Use this command to check the disk size and usage for an application's mounts.

Mounts are directories mounted into the application from a persistent, writable
filesystem. They are configured in the <info>mounts</info> key in the <info>.magento.app.yaml</info> file.

The filesystem's total size is determined by the <info>disk</info> key in the same file.

commands.name: ssh-cert:load
commands.description: Generate an SSH certificate
commands.help:
This command checks if a valid SSH certificate is present, and generates a
new one if necessary.

Certificates allow you to make SSH connections without having previously
uploaded a public key. They are more secure than keys and they allow for
other features.

Normally the certificate is loaded automatically during login, or when
making an SSH connection. So this command is seldom needed.

If you want to set up certificates without login and without an SSH-related
command, for example if you are writing a script that uses an API token via
an environment variable, then you would probably want to run this command
explicitly. For unattended scripts, remember to turn off interaction via
--yes or the MAGENTO_CLOUD_CLI_NO_INTERACTION environment variable.

refresh-only.description: Only refresh the certificate, if necessary (do not write SSH config)

commands.name: tunnel:open
usage: magento-cloud tunnel:open [-g|--gateway-ports] [-p|--project PROJECT] [-e|--environment ENVIRONMENT] [-A|--app APP] [-i|--identity-file IDENTITY-FILE]
commands.description: Open SSH tunnels to an app's relationships
commands.help:
This command opens SSH tunnels to all of the relationships of an application.

Connections can then be made to the application's services as if they were
local, for example a local MySQL client can be used, or the Solr web
administration endpoint can be accessed through a local browser.

This command requires the posix and pcntl PHP extensions (as multiple
background CLI processes are created to keep the SSH tunnels open). The
<info>tunnel:single</info> command can be used on systems without these
extensions.
